pym.auth.manager module¶

pym.auth.manager.create_group(sess, owner, name, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new group record.

For details about **kwargs, see Group.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • owner – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • ctime – Optional timestamp as creation time, defaults to now.
Returns:

Instance of created group.
Raise:

ItemExistsError if group already exists
pym.auth.manager.create_group_member(sess, owner, group, member_user=None, member_group=None, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new group_member record.

For details about **kwargs, see GroupMember.

Returns:Instance of created group_member
Raise:ItemExistsError if group mmber already exists
pym.auth.manager.create_user(sess, owner, is_enabled, principal, pwd, email, groups=None, **kwargs)¶

Creates a new user record.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • owner – ID, principal, or instance of creating user.
  • is_enabled – True to enable this user, False to disable.
  • principal – Principal string for new user.
  • pwd – User’s password. We will encrypt it.
  • email – User’s email address.
  • group_names – List of groups this user shall be member of. User is at least member of group users. If a group does not exist, it is created. Set to False to skip groups altogether.
  • kwargs – See User.
Returns:

Instance of created user.
pym.auth.manager.delete_ace(sess, ace_id, deleter, delete_from_db=False, deletion_reason=None)¶

Deletes an ACE.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • ace_id – ID of an ACE.
  • deleter – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • delete_from_db – Optional. Defaults to just tag as deleted (False), set True to physically delete record from DB.
  • deletion_reason – Optional. Reason for deletion.
Returns:

None if really deleted, else instance of tagged ACE, None if not found.
pym.auth.manager.delete_group(sess, group, deleter, delete_from_db=False)¶

Deletes a group.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • group – ID, name, or instance of a group.
  • deleter – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • delete_from_db – Optional. Defaults to just tag as deleted (False), set True to physically delete record from DB.
Returns:

None if really deleted, else instance of tagged group.
pym.auth.manager.delete_group_member(sess, group_member)¶

Deletes a group_member.

We always delete a group membership physically, there is no tagging as deleted.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • group_member – ID, or instance of a group member.
pym.auth.manager.delete_user(sess, user, deleter, delete_from_db=False)¶

Deletes a user.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • user – ID, name, or instance of a user.
  • deleter – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
  • delete_from_db – Optional. Defaults to just tag as deleted (False), set True to physically delete record from DB.
Returns:

None if really deleted, else instance of tagged user.
pym.auth.manager.update_group(sess, group, editor, **kwargs)¶

Updates a group.

For details about **kwargs, see Group.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • group – ID, name, or instance of a group.
  • editor – ID, principal, or instance of a user.
Returns:

Instance of updated group.
pym.auth.manager.update_user(sess, user, editor, **kwargs)¶

Updates a user.

For details about **kwargs, see User.

Parameters:
  • sess – A DB session instance.
  • user – ID, name, or instance of user to update.
  • editor – ID, principal, or instance of editing user.
Returns:

Instance of updated user.
